page.title: 05RAASAY OUTDOOR CENTRE
page.content: RAASAY HOUSE IS A HOUSE OF GREAT HISTORICAL INTEREST.AT THE PRESENT RAASAY HOUSE IS OWNED BY THE SECRERTARY OF STATE FOR SCOTLAND AND IS USED AS AN OUTDOOR CENTRE. AN OUTDOOR CENTRE IS A BUSINESS WHICH SPECIALISES IN OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CANOEING,WALKING THE ISLAND AND CLIMBING.THERE ARE SIX STAFF AT PRESENT BUT THIS WILL INCREASE TO 24 WHILE THE COURSES ARE ON. ABOUT 50 PEOPLE CAN STAY AT RAASAY HOUSE AT ONE TIME.FOR MOST OF THE COURSES THE ONLY QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED ARE THAT YOU HAVE TO BE FIT.MOST COURSES ARE FOR THE OVER 18'S. STUDENTS COME FROM ALL PARTS OF BRITIAN AND EVERY YEAR A GROUP OF STUDENTS COME FROM A MILITARY ACADEMY IN THE SULTANATE OF OMAN.
